page.title: 01VILLAGE OF BENINGTON (1).
page.content: The centre of the village of Benington justifies the village's reputation of being one of the prettiest in Hertford- shire. Its classic constituents:church, stately home,ancient earthworks, folly, old pub,attractive cottages, duck pond, all surround an open village green. Ducks and geese amble across roadways and green oblivious of passing traffic. Opposite the pond is the gate leading to theÂ£Lordship',a Queen Anne house with a laterÂ£Folly'attached replicating the former Norman Castle which stood on this site.The Gardens,ancient Moat and Folly are open to the publicon Wednes- days and Sundays at certain times of the year.The Church of St.Peter's dates from Saxon times,as does theÂ£Lordship' site which was the former Palace of the Saxon King of Mercia. (Cont)
